Jessica Lam

President | jtl005@ucsd.edu

Hello friends! I'm a 4th Year Bioengineering: Biotechnology student. I'm a huge foodie, but ramen and Thai food are the faves. If you're ever down to get some yummy food off campus (because we all know dorm food isn't that good), feel free to hit me up! I also enjoy going to the beach when I'm not suffering indoors by studying, and really just exploring all that San Diego has to offer. I also enjoy going to concerts and (window) shopping! I'm also a barista, so stop by Cups Coffee and I'll be sure to make you a delicious cup of coffee. If you ever have any questions about BMES, classes, or just life, I'm open to it all!

Michelle Ragsac

Vice-President Internal | mragsac@ucsd.edu

I'm a 3rd year Bioengineering: Bioinformatics major, and I will be acting as this year's Vice-President Internal! I want to help the members of BMES learn about the opportunities avaliable to them, and contribute to providing a fun environment to study, socialize, contribute, and learn in our organization. In my spare time--when I'm not coding, eating, or reading--I like casual photography (especially of photos of my friends and food), dreaming about owning a cat, and sleeping. Send me a message if you have questions about Bioinformatics, UC San Diego life, food spots around campus, or how you can get involved in BMES!

Vikash Morar

Vice-President External | vmorar@ucsd.edu

Hey! I'm Vikash and I'm the Vice-President External for BMES this year! I'm a third-year Biochemistry and Cell Biology major from Sixth College. I really love eating and sleeping, so if you're interested in going out to eat together or learning about the best places to nap on campus, let me know! I also run the professional development workshops for BMES, so if you have any suggestions for workshops that you want to see (including for programming languages, lab skills, etc.), let me know! If you want any individual help for resumes, interviews, or other professional skills in general, feel free to contact me for that as well!

Anurag Coramutla

Vice-President Finance | acoramut@ucsd.edu

I'm a third year student, in Warren College, that is interested in Business. I am pursuing a business management career, hopefully, in the energy or biotech industry. Outside of academics, I enjoy photography. I also compete for the UCSD Club Tennis Team.

Bryan Yeh

Bioengineering Day Chair | bjyeh@ucsd.edu

Hey all! I'm a sophomore in Muir College originating from the far far lands of NorCal. In my free time (heh, what's that), I enjoy browsing Reddit, playing video games such as smash or league, and watching anime. Cool new tech and gadgets always interest me. Feel free to message me out of the blue to talk and make a new friend! I'm also down to hang out, play tennis, or any other fun activities.

Julie Yip

Bioengineering Day Chair | jlyip@ucsd.edu

Hey there! My name is Julie and I am a second Bioengineering: Biotechnology major at Warren College. I love singing with friends, reading food blogs and experiencing live music. If you ever want to fangirl/fanboy over any artist, talk to me! I am always open to new recommendations (and I love listening to people talk about their passions). Also, in addition to bioengineering, I want to be a science writer in the future. If any of this sounds like you too, I think you're cool, and we should hang out. If it doesn't...well, we should still hang out. Cheers!

Yajur Maker

Translational Medicine Day Chair | ymaker@eng.ucsd.edu

As a 3rd year Bioengineer, I am focused on translating my research interests into innovative medical technologies. To do this, I focus on creating low cost medical devices in the Engineering World Health organization, work on mimicking bone structure in the McKittrick Biomaterials Lab, and have helped to start Translational Medicine Day to inspire undergraduate students to pursue Translational Medicine. In my free time I also enjoy long walks on the Beach. And Food. Lets not forget food.

Vincent Hu

Translational Medicine Day Chair | vjhu@ucsd.edu

Hey! I am a second year Bioengineering: Bioengineering major planing to petition for a second major in mathematics: Computer science. As the Translational Medicine day Co-chair, I plan to make Translational Medicine day an amazing event that shows off the power of interdisciplinary communication between research and medicine. and I enjoy fooling around with cards, playing piano, and practicing calligraphy. My favorite drink is milk and I used to drink probably way too much of it. I hope to see you around!
